job_title: Director of Student Programs in Nashville, TN
pros: Geneva College is a great place to work! The mission of the institution is worthy cause. The staff and students make you love coming to work each and everyday.
cons: As higher education continues to go through a financial shift, Geneva - like most smaller liberal arts Christian Colleges - will continue to have to make tough staffing decisions in the days ahead.

review_title: The Center for Faith and Practice was a fabulous place to work!
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Beaver Falls, PA
pros: The staff and faculty are very kind. Student development is a place for friendship and hard work. I have enjoyed my time there.
cons: The school has a very small budget. It made me feel like my hands were tied when I wanted to plan an event.

job_title: Associate Professor in Beaver Falls, PA
pros: free tuition for kids; good meal plan at dining hall; plenty of opportunity to hear guest speakers; good Christian environment; beautiful campus, though a bit small;
cons: lack of leadership; low compensation; it is called a suburban school but a little too far from a major city such as Pittsburgh

review_title: TA: great faculty, huge time drain

cons:
Huge time commitment--definitely beyond amount indicated in job description.
